answers.answer: My mom worked in the OB for a really long time. She's always said its fairly common. Some people will even continue having regular periods for many months. On this app it's even listed as a symptom. Just mention it to your doctor when you go! :) Congratulations!!
Thank you so much .. I haven't even set up my first appointment yet.

Me either. I'm 8 weeks 4 days along, so we pretty close to the same. :) I'm telling my husband and step daughter tonight. Then I guess we will set one up from there. Are you nervous about the first appointment? I am. I worry about not asking the right questions and all of that.
Will my husband know already but we're going to wait till I'm close to 5 months.. I'm taking the prenatal pills already I should be ok to wait.. and of course I am I'm a first time mom
Nunu are u waiting five months to tell anyone or to see your dr?
To see a doctor and everyone else
They recommend you see your doctor after 8 weeks. That way they can check for certain things that can harm you or the baby early on. Like anemia or preeclampsia.

question: I'll be 8 weeks today and last month and this month I have what I thought was my period it only lasted a day then it was gone no cramping or anything.should I be worried..
title: 8 today
